column2: How the Actavis deal upended Allergan No. 2's CEO ambitionsHow the Actavis deal upended Allergan No. 2's CEO ambitions For two decades
column3: Allergan Inc president Doug Ingram labored to transform the Botox-maker from a sleepy eye care upstart to a global aesthetics giant. He was just a few months away from getting the top job when a merger deal with Actavis Plc in November thwarted his ambitions. column2: State Street cuts fees on 41 ETFs as price competition heats up NEW YORK
column3: Feb 3 State Street Corp said on Tuesday it has slashed management fees on 41 of its SPDR exchange-traded funds
column4: joining major ETF providers BlackRock Inc  and Vanguard in their efforts to lower fees as price competition heats up.

column2: Target picks former Tesco executive McNamara as new CIO Feb 3 U.S. retailer Target Corp on Tuesday named Mike McNamara
column3: a former executive at British retailer Tesco PLC
column4: its new chief information officer.

column2: Little sign of progress after contact to end U.S. refinery strike resume HOUSTON A strike by U.S. refinery workers entered a third day on Tuesday as contact resumed between the lead industry negotiator
column3: Royal Dutch Shell Plc
column4: and union leaders over a new nationwide wage deal.
